intro: Quinchamalium stuebelii, commonly known as the Stuebel's quinchamalium, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and violet. The plant has a compact growth habit with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
